page.title: 13Changes In Ingleton Village
page.content: {1}More old people, fewer young people. Number of school children falling:_ 1961 {91}children on roll at Ingleton 1971 {67} 1975 {57 1981 {58 1985 {53 {2}There are more houses and people are buying their homes rather than renting. {3}Small farms are disappearing and fewer men are needed as farms are mechanized.Fields are larger and farms specialize. {4}Only one shop remains in Ingleton,a grocers and Post Office combined. {5}New school built in 1967.Today school meals are provided, a crossing patrol helps children cross the road,and children go swimming and do more practical work. {6}No policeman resident in village.
